poem:
Title: "Ode to Pembrolizumab"

Pembrolizumab, curious elixir,
Distilling courage from dread, a gamechanger –
Chasing the specter of cancer away,
In the bowels of morning, a glistening ray.

As an explorer seeks out hidden treasure,
So defenses unlock with this wondrous measure,
Where destruction is the making of life –
A pause in the cadence of surgical strife.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Drug that ‘melts away’ tumours hailed as ‘gamechanger’ for some bowel cancer patients A “gamechanger” immunotherapy drug that “melts away” tumours dramatically increases the chances of curing some bowel cancers and may even replace the need for surgery, doctors have said. Pembrolizumab targets and blocks a specific protein on the surface of immune cells that then seek out and destroy cancer cells. Giving the drug before surgery instead of chemotherapy led to a huge increase". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
